name: msal-extensions
description: Microsoft Authentication Library extensions (MSAL EX) provides a persistence API that can save your data on disk, encrypted on Windows, macOS and Linux. Concurrent data access will be coordinated by a file lock mechanism.

repo.name: microsoft-authentication-extensions-for-python
repo.description: Microsoft Authentication Library extensions (MSAL EX) provides a persistence API that can save your data on disk, encrypted on Windows, macOS and Linux. Concurrent data access will be coordinated by a file lock mechanism.

readme.summary: Well-structured documentation with clear installation and examples, but lacking troubleshooting guidance and detailed configuration options.
readme.top_issue: Missing troubleshooting section for common issues like LibSecret installation on Linux, DPAPI errors on Windows, or keychain access problems on Mac

injection_risks.description: Potential for path traversal in os.path.expanduser(lock_location)
Use of string formatting to write process ID and command line arguments to lock file

critical_findings: Potential for path traversal in os.path.expanduser(lock_location)
Use of string formatting to write process ID and command line arguments to lock file
security.summary: The msal-extensions package has some security concerns, including potential path traversal and use of string formatting, but overall it appears to be well-designed with proper error handling and no hardcoded secrets.

common_complaints: Broken dependency (portalocker incompatibility causing runtime failures)
Confusing branch structure and unclear contribution guidelines
Unnecessary test files shipped in production package
Unwanted transitive dependencies (pywin32, PyGObject) in non-graphical environments
Lack of feature parity with JavaScript MSAL (Redis cache support)
sentiment.summary: Community health is poor with a critical unresolved runtime bug, unclear maintenance practices, and slow responsiveness to user issues and feature requests.

communication.summary: The maintainer's responses are clear, helpful, and demonstrate a good level of patience and technical depth.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being from September 2025
11 open issues with no recent resolution activity
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no bug fixes or maintenance
No merged pull requests in past 6 months showing no feature development
No active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests no recent version updates
positive_signals: Repository still exists and has not been archived
maintenance.summary: msal-extensions appears abandoned or in unmaintained state with no development activity, issue resolution, or releases in the past 6 months.
